body.p:
Lexington Ky March 29th 1861.
His Excellency Beriah Magoffin:

Dr Sir; I have a young friend, William C Goodloe, who has been appointed private secretary to Cassius M Clay, and he is desirous of being appointed Colonel. The reason for it is, That Mr Clay intends adopting the United States military uniform at the court in Europe to which he has been selected as minister, and wishes his staff to dress accordingly. Green Clay his secretary of Legation is already a Colonel by your appointment and if if you would also give this rank to William C Goodloe, for the reasons stated, you would much oblige,
Your obt Serv't, Bryan H Allen

Aid
Wm. C. Goodloe
Comd Mar 3d 1861
Issue comission & mail this evening to the writer or the Col.
